ai.summary: Crook Hill Circular (Ethel) is a 14.3 km moderate circular hike in the High Peak area of the UK. The route combines grassy moorland, rocky paths, and wooded segments, with gentle to moderate climbs and a few uneven sections. It offers open views on higher sections and a varied walking experience suitable for walkers with some hill experience.
ai.terrain_summary: Ground varies from well-trodden grassy trails to rocky, rutted paths. Expect a mix of stony tracks, muddy patches after rain, and occasional boggy stretches. The route includes occasional short ascents and descents with uneven surfaces, and the higher sections can be exposed to wind.
ai.safety_notes: Plan according to the weather; UK conditions can change rapidly. Check forecast the night before and start early in winter. Tell someone your route and expected return. Stay on marked paths, avoid steep drops, and be mindful of livestock and other hikers. Bring adequate clothing, food, and water. Carry a map and compass; have a charged mobile phone as a backup. In wet conditions, allow extra time for slower terrain.
recommended_gear: Weather-appropriate layers (base layer, insulating layer, and shell)
Water bottle or hydration system (2–3 liters for longer walks)
Energy-rich snacks and a small lunch
Map and compass (and optional GPS device)
Fully charged phone with offline maps
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (roughly March to October) generally offers the best conditions and daylight for this 14.3 km circuit. Summer provides longer daylight and clearer views, while spring and autumn bring wildlife activity and fewer crowds. Be prepared for sudden weather changes year-round.

seo.title: Crook Hill Circular (Ethel) – 14.3 km Moderate Hike in High Peak, UK
seo.meta_description: Explore the Crook Hill Circular (Ethel): a 14.3 km moderate hike through the High Peak area of the UK. Varied terrain, moorland scenery, and a rewarding circuit for walkers with some hill experience.
seo.h1: Crook Hill Circular (Ethel) – High Peak Walk (14.3 km, Moderate)
